newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian shares seen inching up on selective buying.
newsitem.headline: Indian shares seen inching up on selective buying.

text.p: ** Bombay shares expected to open higher and seen inching
ahead on selective sector purchases, traders say
** First day of trade cycle on the National Stock Exchange
** Multinational shares seen spearheading the rally
** Market positive on Indian blue-chips State Bank and
Reliance, trader at a foreign brokerage says
** Action expected at select cash counters such as Bata,
Ashok Leyland, EID Parry and Satyam Computers
** HDFC shares seen under continued pressure after hitting
watchlist of firms about to touch FII purchase ceiling
** A correction in the market's rise seen checkmated by
fresh purchases at every fall, dealers say
